column4: Hey guys, I installed php5 on edgy.  I tried going into a wordpress installation and Im getting the error:
Fatal error: Allowed memory size of 8388608 bytes exhausted (tried to allocate 368640 bytes)
maybe you have a ulimit set
soz for the spam in the window
ulimit is provided by bash, the documentation can be read by running 'help ulimit'
I just increased the php memory in php.ini to 24M.  That did the trick
i don't know much about PHP, but i know highly threaded applications tend to run out of stack space very quickly
for mod_php the module is libapache2-mod-php5
then your install is borked. i would try some art-get remove --purge's and then reinstall
hmm...well I did have lighttpd installed as well...
